content: Invitations have gone out for Dec 16th. If you were invited to the last session and you didn't receive your invite LMK.
:wave: this is today in 20 minutes, right?
(I forgot until I got a calendar notification :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes: )
Starting in 7 mins. The zoom is open. :)

Doc Jones said:

Starting in 7 mins. The zoom is open. :)

Just want to check in about this; the calendar invite I have has a Zoom link that currently isn't open. Maybe there are two separate links again?
@rylev @Esteban Küber :wave: were you planning to come?
I'm in but I'll have to pop out before half-past to deal with a personal matter, sadly :(

oh I meant to say before I left - another good PR would be to add an assert that there's no NameBindingKind that's a Res with its kind set to DefKind::Use - I think those should be using NameBindingKind::Import instead
@Joshua Nelson Would you post the link to setting up rust analyzer with rustc here?
Is this what you were looking for https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/building/suggested.html#configuring-rust-analyzer-for-rustc
Fwiw the way I find that link is going to rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org and then searching "rust-analyzer"

Capturing a suggestion from yesterday: in our code reading, work towards an understanding of the code that ties back to complete concrete examples. This could be captured in a "lifetime of a resolved name"-style document, which could e.g. be contributed back to the rustc dev guide.
Documentation inspiration: https://github.com/lifting-bits/remill/blob/master/docs/LIFE_OF_AN_INSTRUCTION.md
